title: X Factor Celebrity live shows will be unrecognisable amid set shake up
text:
What will viewers make of this? (Picture: Rex)

X Factor: Celebrity’s live shows will be unrecognisable on Saturday night as producers have decided to axe the large studio audience for a more intimate set-up.

In another major shake-up, the new ITV studio has been revamped to resemble a jazz club instead of the usual big set.

Instead of fans sitting in tiered seats, guests will bet sat on luxury tables dotted around the floor with velvet seats.

‘The show has a totally fresh feel – it looks amazing,’ an insider claimed.

‘There is no large scale studio audience this time around, the standard layout resembles that of a jazz club.

‘Producers have gone all out in terms of production.’

The studio will look completely different (Picture: Wenn)

The source went on to explain to the Daily Star Online that bosses have splashed out on velvet turquoise seats, low lighting lamps and holographic walls.

Advertisement

Advertisement

What will stay the same is that judges Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh will all remain on the top table.

On Saturday night’s episode, we will see Vinnie Jones make his debut as he will sing a song as a tribute to his late wife Tanya.

The 54-year-old is joining X Factor just weeks after his wife died and he says she had hoped to be alive to see him in the competition.

Jenny Ryan from The Chase will also be performing on Saturday after she was initially axed by judge Nicole Scherzinger at the auditions – however soon after it was announced they were bringing her back.

Ahead of the live shows former Eastender’s actor, Jonny Labey exclusively spoke to Metro.co.uk about his journey so far.

The former soap star is the only contestant bringing swing music to the show, but he explained that when it comes to the different themes every week, he has a gameplan.

‘I mean it’s nice to know your branding, swing has always been a big part of my life but the reception I had from LA was great,’ he explained.

‘I am just concentrating on getting through to week two at this stage, but these shows move on so quickly and things are always changing so it’s important to have a game plan.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It also depends on the reactions and the judge’s comments, but I feel there’s a new-old era with swing music and I don’t feel it’s something anyone is doing at the moment.

‘I am using songs that aren’t necessarily linked to swing and I putting my own vibe on it as well.’

X Factor Celebrity continues Saturday at 8.20pm on ITV.

description: X Factor Celebrity: Live shows will be unrecognisable as bosses axe large studio audience for luxury jazz club set.
